Posted By: themlsna (6/6/2010 1:07:02 PM)

posts.post_content:
I don't know which is more hilarious, the fact that he looks like he's about to give someone a massage, or the little flying wizards in the background. I didn't notice them at first, but my goodness my heart just about stopped when I did.   
It's like they were desperate to compensate for the lameness of the effect by making it look really scary... And failed horribly. I want to see an animated version of this card where they're flapping their little arms.

Posted By: OrzhovGhostCouncil (5/19/2010 1:03:50 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
The worst of the Gempalm cycle, without a doubt. The others:  
- Deal damage based on the number of goblins you have  
- Cause life loss based on the number of zombies you have  
- Give all your elves a boost  
- Give all your soldiers a boost and first strike  
  
All of these can win you the game. This one just makes your wizards, at best, unblockable for a turn and draws you a card. Unspectacular, and the hilarious art makes an already iffy deck archetype even less viable.
posts.html:

- Give all your elves a boost

All of these can win you the game. This one just makes your wizards, at best, unblockable for a turn and draws you a card. Unspectacular, and the hilarious art makes an already iffy deck archetype even less viable.

Posted By: BegleOne (3/15/2012 7:04:53 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Wait... aggro wizards? Is that even a thing?  
  
There are 24 wizards with more than 3 power. 6 of them already have flying. Of those that *don't* already have flying, 12 are cmc 6 or more and 2 others have to flip first.  
  
And beyond that, nearly every wizard has an activated ability way more effective than their brute strength. When I see [Azami, Lady of Scrolls](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Azami, Lady of Scrolls) hit the table, the *last* thing I'm worried about is that she might gain *flying.*
posts.html:
Wait... aggro wizards? Is that even a thing?

There are 24 wizards with more than 3 power. 6 of them already have flying. Of those that don't already have flying, 12 are cmc 6 or more and 2 others have to flip first.

And beyond that, nearly every wizard has an activated ability way more effective than their brute strength. When I see Azami, Lady of Scrolls hit the table, the last thing I'm worried about is that she might gain flying.
